body:
Comment 3 by **goprogger@gmx.de**: 
$ stat /dev/sda1

says:

Size: 0         	Blocks: 0          IO Block: 4096

So it's a linux-stat thing then.

I found a workaround for me. I call my program with the parameter $(blockdev --getsize64
/dev/sdb1) to give it the correct size. Would be nice if one could do it from within the
program.
